previous_positions: Staff Software Engineer – Square (2013 – 2016, built Square Cash)
Senior Software Engineer – Google (2010 – 2012, Google+ Messenger & Hangouts integration)
achievements: Co-Founded **Faire**, one of the most successful wholesale/e-commerce platforms of the last decade, now projected to reach **$500M in revenue in 2025**.
Scaled Faire through pandemic disruptions, inflation, tariffs, and economic uncertainty while maintaining **95%+ gross retention and 110%+ net retention**.
Led engineering for **Square Cash**, taking it from prototype to large-scale consumer product.
At Google, integrated **Hangouts into Google+** and built core Android/iOS communication features used by millions.

recent_achievements: Driving Faire’s technical architecture as the company expands into new AI-driven initiatives like agentic tooling and swarm-coding.
Faire highlighted in *The Information* for resilience and growth despite economic volatility.
Hosting events on **Transforming Wholesale with AI** to push innovation in retail/e-commerce.
conversation_starters: Ask about Faire’s expansion into AI-powered agentic tooling for retail.
Discuss his experience building Square Cash and what he learned transitioning into large-scale marketplace architecture.
Mention how Faire has become a benchmark for e-commerce resilience and growth.
Bring up Waterloo roots and startup culture (ties to Google, Square, and UW alumni network).
notable_projects: Faire – B2B wholesale/e-commerce platform serving independent retailers globally
Square Cash – grew from prototype to mainstream consumer product
Google+ Messenger and Hangouts integration – core Android/iOS communications

credibility_indicators: Co-Founder of Faire, a multi-billion-dollar company in e-commerce
Significant engineering leadership roles at Square and Google
Recognized in media (The Information, event talks)
potential_red_flags: Very company-focused (primarily Faire) – limited visible activity beyond it.
Public commentary mostly through reposts rather than original thought leadership.
person_analysis.overview: Marcelo Cortes is the Co-Founder and Chief Architect of Faire, one of the most successful wholesale/e-commerce platforms of the past decade, projected to hit $500M in revenue by 2025. With a background in software engineering at Google and Square, where he helped build and scale products like Square Cash and Google+ Messenger, Marcelo blends deep technical expertise with startup execution. He is known for driving resilient architecture and scaling Faire through economic headwinds, while pushing the boundaries of AI-driven innovation in retail.
person_analysis.executive_summary: Marcelo Cortes is a Brazilian-Canadian entrepreneur and engineering leader, best known as Co-Founder and Chief Architect of Faire. He has a proven track record of scaling large-scale consumer and enterprise platforms, from Square Cash at Square to Faire’s global wholesale marketplace. A University of Waterloo graduate, he combines technical excellence, startup resilience, and architectural vision to shape the future of retail and AI-powered marketplaces.
key_insights: Co-founded and scaled **Faire** into one of the leading global e-commerce marketplaces.
Experience bridging consumer apps (Square Cash, Google+) and enterprise platforms.
Technical leader skilled at resilient scaling during macroeconomic turbulence.
Influential in applying AI/agentic tooling to real-world retail problems.
